ca.ualberta.cs.c301f13t13.backend

Class SHController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.c301f13t13.backend.SHController

  • public class SHController
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: Is called by the views of the application to then interact with the manager classes to handle all types of data (story, chapter, media, choice). This class does not directly interact with the database or server, only the managers. Design Pattern: Singleton
    Author:
    Stephanie Gil, Ashley Brown

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SHController getInstance(Context context)
        Returns an instance of the general controller as a singleton.
        Returns:
        SHController

      • getAllStories

        public java.util.ArrayList<Story> getAllStories(ObjectType type)
        Gets all the stories that are either cached, created by the author, or published.
        Parameters:
        type - Will either be PUBLISHED_STORY, CACHED_STORY, or CREATED_STORY.
        Returns:
        Array list of all the stories the application asked for.

      • getAllChapters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Chapter> getAllChapters(java.util.UUID storyId)
        Retrieves all the chapters that are in a given story.
        Parameters:
        storyId - Id of the story the chapters are wanted from.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the chapters.

      • getAllChoices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Choice> getAllChoices(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves all the choices that are in a chapter.
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter the choices are wanted from.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the chapter's choices.

      • getAllIllustrations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getAllIllustrations(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves all the illustrations that are in a chapter.
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter the illustrations are wanted from.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the illustrations.

      • getFirstIllustration

        public Media getFirstIllustration(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves the first illustration of a chapter. Returns null if the chapter has no illustrations.
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter the illustrations are wanted from.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the illustrations.

      • getAllPhotos

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getAllPhotos(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves all the photos that are in a chapter.
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter the photos are wanted from.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the photos.

      • addObject

        public void addObject(java.lang.Object object,
             ObjectType type)
        Adds either a story, chapter, or choice.
        Parameters:
        object - Object to be inserted (must either be a Story, Chapter, Choice, or Media object).
        type - Will either be CHAPTER, CHOICE, MEDIA, PUBLISHED_STORY, CACHED_STORY, CREATED_STORY

      • searchStory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Story> searchStory(java.lang.String title,
                                     java.lang.String author,
                                     ObjectType type)
        Used to search for stories matching the given search criteria. Users can either search by specifying the title or author of the story. All stories that match will be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the story user is looking for.
        author - Author of the story user is looking for.
        type - Will either be PUBLISHED, CACHED, or CREATED
        Returns:
        ArrayList of stories that matched the search criteria.

      • getCompleteChapter

        public Chapter getCompleteChapter(java.util.UUID id)
        Retrieves a complete chapter (including any photos, illustrations, and choices).
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the chapter wanted.
        Returns:
        The complete chapter.

      • getCompleteStory

        public Story getCompleteStory(java.util.UUID id)
        Retrieves a complete story (including chapters, and any photos, illustrations, and choices belonging to the chapters).
        Parameters:
        id - Story id of the story wanted.
        Returns:
        The complete story.

      • updateObject

        public void updateObject(java.lang.Object object,
                ObjectType type)
        Updates either a story, chapter, or choice object. Must specify what type of object it getting updated. Also, updates are happening to the database of the phone, not the server.
        Parameters:
        object - Object to be updated.
        type - Will either be CHAPTER, CHOICE, MEDIA, PUBLISHED_STORY, CACHED_STORY, CREATED_STORY
